Package mainForm

Class MainController

java.lang.Object
mainForm.MainController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class MainController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
This is the controller class for the MainForm xml. This class will handle any functions while using the mainForm and is the centerpiece of the inventory application.
Author:
Jason Jackson

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize​(URL url, ResourceBundle rb)
      This method initializes appropriate values when the mainForm is presented to the user. FUTURE ENHANCEMENTS: There are a number of potential future enhancements to this project. In particular, if I were to try and improve this product, I would look at the ability to automatically compile order lists for the inventory. To do so, we could check how many products are needed in inventory, and compare their associated parts to the stock of parts in inventory. If there is too few parts for the stock of Products, an order list would automatically be created to balance out the number of parts.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - supplied by the JavaFX library.
      rb - supplied by the JavaFX library.

    • partDeleteButtonPressed

      public void partDeleteButtonPressed()
      This method is called when the delete button is pressed. It will call the deletePart function on any selected part in the partsView TableView.

    • addPart

      public void addPart​(int autoGenID, Part newPart)
      This method adds a part to the Inventory system and then calls the refresh method to update the partsView TableView
      Parameters:
      autoGenID - the current autoGenID for the mainController.
      newPart - the new Part class to be added to the Inventory.

    • modifyPart

      public void modifyPart​(int index, Part newPart, int autoGenID)
      This method modifies an existing part in the Inventory system and then calls the refresh method to update the partsView TableView
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the part to be modified in the Inventory parts list.
      newPart - the new value that the Part will be changed to.
      autoGenID - the current autoGenID for the mainController.

    • deletePart

      public void deletePart​(Part selectedPart)
      This method prompts the user to confirm the deletion, deletes an existing part in the Inventory system, and then calls the refresh method to update the partsView TableView.
      Parameters:
      selectedPart - the Part that will be deleted.

    • addProduct

      public void addProduct​(int autoGenID, Product newProduct)
      This method adds a product to the Inventory system and then calls the refresh method to update the productsView TableView
      Parameters:
      autoGenID - the current autoGenID for the mainController.
      newProduct - the new Product class to be added to the Inventory.

    • modifyProduct

      public void modifyProduct​(int index, Product newProduct, int autoGenID)
      This method modifies an existing Product in the Inventory system and then calls the refresh method to update the productsView TableView RUNTIME/LOGICAL ERROR: One logical error that I was running into was my autoGenID resetting any time I modified a part or product. If I were to add a part or product afterwards, it was giving me part/product IDs that were already used. What I realized is that I was attempting to send just the autoGenID to the Part/Product Controllers, and the returned value was the ID of the modified part. To get around this, I had to change the methods that passed around autoID to also include a parameter with the modified part's ID. That way the autoGenID wasn't getting updated when control was passed back to the MainController.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the product to be modified in the Inventory parts list.
      newProduct - the new value that the Product will be changed to.
      autoGenID - the current autoGenID for the mainController.

    • deleteProduct

      public void deleteProduct​(Product selectedProduct)
      This method prompts the user to confirm the deletion, deletes an existing product in the Inventory system, and then calls the refresh method to update the productsView TableView.
      Parameters:
      selectedProduct - the Product that will be deleted.

    • partRefreshTableView

      public void partRefreshTableView​(int autoGenID)
      This method is used by the part controller to pass along the autoGenID value and call the refresh method.
      Parameters:
      autoGenID - the current autoGenID value.

    • productRefreshTableView

      public void productRefreshTableView​(int autoGenID)
      This method is used by the product controller to pass along the autoGenID value and call the refresh method.
      Parameters:
      autoGenID - the current autoGenID value.

    • refresh

      private void refresh()
      This method updates and repopulates the partsView and productsView TableViews

    • searchFindsPart

      private boolean searchFindsPart​(Part part, String searchText)
      This method determines whether the supplied Part's id or name contains the String in the searchBox.
      Parameters:
      part - the Part to check against the searchText string.
      searchText - the String to check against the Part's id and name.
      Returns:
      boolean whether a match was found or not.

    • filterPartList

      private javafx.collections.ObservableList<Part> filterPartList​(List<Part> list, String searchText)
      This method calls the searchFindsPart method for each Part in a Part list and then returns a list of Parts containing the stringText.
      Parameters:
      list - the Part list to filter based off the searchText String.
      searchText - the String supplied by the searchBox TextField
      Returns:
      a Part list of Parts that contained the searchText String.

    • searchFindsProduct

      private boolean searchFindsProduct​(Product product, String searchText)
      This method determines whether the supplied Product's id or name contains the String in the searchBox.
      Parameters:
      product - the Product to check against the searchText string.
      searchText - the String to check against the Product's id and name.
      Returns:
      boolean whether a match was found or not.

    • filterProductList

      private javafx.collections.ObservableList<Product> filterProductList​(List<Product> list, String searchText)
      This method calls the searchFindsProduct method for each Product in a Product list and then returns a list of Products containing the stringText.
      Parameters:
      list - the Product list to filter based off the searchText String.
      searchText - the String supplied by the searchBox TextField
      Returns:
      a Product list of Products that contained the searchText String.
